segment.documentation: BGM, A segment to indicate the type and function of the message and to transmit the identifying number.
CTA, A segment to identify a person or department to whom communication should be directed.
COM, A segment to identify a communication number of a person or department to whom communication should be directed.
DTM, A segment to indicate date(s) and time(s) applying to the whole message.
TSR, A segment to identify the contract, conditions of carriage, services and priority requirements for the transport.
CUX, A segment to indicate the currency applicable to the whole message.
MOA, A segment to indicate a monetary value applying to the whole message.
FTX, A segment to specify free form or processable supplementary information. In computer-to-computer exchanges free form text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.
RFF, A segment to express a reference which applies to the entire message.
CNT, A segment to specify control totals for the shipment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments to identify the routing and date(s)/time(s) of the calculation.

segment.documentation: LOC, A segment to identify a location.
DTM, A segment to indicate date(s) and time(s) related to the location.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments to indicate the charge methodology which applies to the entire message.

segment.documentation: CPI, A segment to indicate the default charge methodology.
CUX, A segment to indicate the charge calculation currency.
LOC, A segment to indicate a place related to the charge methodology.
MOA, A segment to identify the monetary amount associated with the charges, e.g. a maximum acceptable amount.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments to specify the transport calculation selection criteria.

segment.documentation: TDT, A segment to indicate information related to the mode, means of transport and carrier.
DTM, A segment to indicate date(s) and time(s) related to the details of transport.
TSR, A segment to identify contract, conditions of carriage, services, priority requirements for this means of transport/carrier.
LOC, A segment to indicate a location related to the details of transport.
FTX, A segment to specify free form or processable supplementary information associated with the details of transport.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments to specify an additional reference and date(s) related to the means of transport/carrier.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to identify a reference.
DTM, A segment to indicate date(s) and time(s) related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments to identify a party, related references, locations and contacts.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify the party's name, address and function.
LOC, A segment to indicate a location where a specific function will be performed.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments to identify a contact and its communication channels, related to the party.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department within a party.
COM, A segment to identify the communication numbers of person or department to whom communication should be directed.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments to specify references and date(s)/time(s) related to the party.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to identify a reference used by the party.
DTM, A segment to indicate date(s) and time(s) related to the party.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: SG13-SG15-SG17-SG18 A group of segments to describe the goods items for which the charges are calculated.

segment.documentation: GID, A segment to identify a goods item for which charges are calculated.
HAN, A segment to specify handling instructions relating to the goods item.
TMP, A segment to specify a temperature setting for the goods item.
RNG, A segment to specify a temperature range setting for the goods item.
LOC, A segment to identify a place/location relating to the goods item, e.g. the place where the goods item will be available for pick-up.
FTX, A segment to specify free form or processable additional information relating to the goods item.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments to identify and describe the goods.

segment.documentation: GDS, A segment to describe the nature of cargo.
FTX, A segment to describe the goods in free form.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments to specify measurements applicable to the goods item.

segment.documentation: MEA, A segment to specify measurements (weight and/or volume), other than dimensions, applicable to the goods item.
EQN, A segment to specify the number of units for which weights or volumes are expressed.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A group of segments to specify dimensions applicable to the goods item.

segment.documentation: DIM, A segment to specify dimensions applicable to the goods item.
EQN, A segment to specify the number of units for which dimensions are expressed.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A group of segments to specify references related to the goods item.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to specify a reference related to the goods item.
EQN, A segment to indicate the number of units for which the given reference applies.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: A group of segments to identify transport details and related measurements for a goods item.

segment.documentation: TPL, A segment to identify transport details for a goods item.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: A group of segments to identify measurements.

segment.documentation: MEA, A segment to specify the distribution of a goods item among the transport details.
EQN, A segment to indicate the number of units to which the given measurements apply.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 15: A group of segments to specify the distribution of a goods item among the transport equipment.

segment.documentation: SGP, A segment to identify equipment in which goods will be transported.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 16: A group of segments to specify measurements of the split goods and the related number of equipment units.

segment.documentation: MEA, A segment to specify the distribution of a goods item among the equipment.
EQN, A segment to indicate the number of equipment units to which the given measurements apply.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 17: DTM-FTX A group of segments to specify charges associated with the goods item.

segment.documentation: TCC, A segment to specify charges associated with the goods item.
PRI, A segment to specify price details (price and unit price basis).
EQN, A segment to specify the number of units to which the unit price basis applies.
PCD, A segment to indicate the applicable reduction or surcharge percentage details.
MOA, A segment to specify a monetary amount (prepaid, discount, etc.).
QTY, A segment to indicate a quantity, for example a chargeable weight.
LOC, A segment to indicate a location where a specific function will be performed.
RFF, A segment to specify a reference related to the calculated charge, e.g. reference to a specific contract.
MEA, A segment to specify measurements, e.g. minimum limit of weight for which the charge and price are applicable.
CUX, A segment to specify the currency in which the charge is expressed or must be expressed.
DTM, A segment to specify a date/time related to the charge calculation, e.g. the expire date of the calculation result.
FTX, A segment to specify free form additional information related with the charge calculation.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 18: A group of segments to specify dangerous goods details related to the goods item. One goods item may be in different goods classes.

segment.documentation: DGS, A segment to specify the class of dangerous goods, packing group, etc.
FTX, A segment to specify the dangerous goods technical name and any other additional dangerous goods information.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 19: A group of segments to identify dangerous goods measurements.

segment.documentation: MEA, A segment to specify the measurements of the dangerous goods.
EQN, A segment to specify the number of equipment units to which the measurements apply.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 20: A group of segments to specify the distribution of the dangerous goods among the transport equipment.

segment.documentation: SGP, A segment to identify the equipment in which the dangerous goods have to be transported.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 21: A group of segments to identify measurements of dangerous goods which are split.

segment.documentation: MEA, A segment to specify measurements of that portion of the dangerous goods in the equipment.
EQN, A segment to specify the number of units to each of which the given measurement applies.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 22: A group of segments to specify equipment in which goods must be transported.

segment.documentation: EQD, A segment to specify equipment and/or equipment size and type.
EQN, A segment to specify the number of pieces of equipment required.
FTX, A segment to specify free form or processable supplementary information associated with the equipment.
